meta.content: Jeopardy Archive David Albrecht Pam Bearce Frank Hughes Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #531.

td.p: David Albrecht, a student from Kansas City
Pam Bearce, a commercial property manager from Kaneohe, Hawaii
Frank Hughes, an account executive from Torrance, California (whose 3-day cash winnings total $21,800)

tr.td: THE HUMAN BODY
FOLK SONGS
SPORTS
ARGENTINA
QUOTES
(Alex: And finally one of the fun categories we have used on the program...)
STUPID ANSWERS

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_DJ_5_2', 'clue_DJ_5_2_stuck', '(David: What is New Orleans?)

Chattanooga (Shoe Shine Boy)

David
')
div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_DJ_5_2', 'clue_DJ_5_2_stuck', '(Alex: Here comes the music.)

"Have you ever passed the corner of Fourth and Grand /
Where a little ball of rhythm has a shoe shine stand? /
People gather round and they clap their hands /
He\'s a great big bundle of joy /
He pops the boogie woogie rag..."

City in which you\'d find title character of this song

"...Yeah, he charges you a nickel just to shine one shoe /
He makes the oldest kind of leather look like new /
You feel as though you wanna dance when he gets through..."')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
(Alex: Here comes the music.)
"Have you ever passed the corner of Fourth and Grand /
Where a little ball of rhythm has a shoe shine stand? /
People gather round and they clap their hands /
He's a great big bundle of joy /
He pops the boogie woogie rag..."
City in which you'd find title character of this song
"...Yeah, he charges you a nickel just to shine one shoe /
He makes the oldest kind of leather look like new /
You feel as though you wanna dance when he gets through..."

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
